commit_message:
config: Alternate File Formats

Currently just a discussion of the options available for different
backends for the upcoming summit session.

Change-Id: I2ea0b0a0127fe82cf15f939a502510ff2be8e684
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/62/182062/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========================================== Alternate backend formats for oslo.config =========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo?searchtext=alternate-config-formats There have occasionally been requests for oslo.config to support backend file formats other than the current ini-style. There seem to be a couple of reasons behind these requests, which may call for different solutions. This spec is currently intended as a way to drive a summit discussion around this topic, and will probably need changes to be implementable. Problem description =================== As noted, there are two major drivers behind this new functionality: 1) The ability to use non-ini style data as a backend for oslo.config. This might mean simply a different file format such as json or yaml, or it might be an entire external service devoted to config management, such as etcd. 2) The ability to represent more complex data structures in OpenStack configuration files. This could be addressed by a solution to the first point, but for existing services with large numbers of existing ini-style config files in the field, switching file formats wholesale is unlikely to be a realistic option. While in theory it is possible to encode json data into an existing StrOpt, this can be problematic due to the escaping needed when using different config tools. One example I was given is to represent the following config using puppet:: pci_passthrough_whitelist = [{"vendor_id": "8086", "product_id": "0443"}, {"vendor_id": "1234", "product_id": "5678"}] Which then becomes:: pci_passthrough_whitelist = "[\{\"vendor_id\":\"8086\",\"product_id\":\"0443\"\},\{\"vendor_id\":\"1234\",\"product_id\":\"5678\"\}]" Not a terribly readable config. Proposed change =============== Josh Harlow has proposed a separate spec_ that addresses the first point, which uses an abstraction layer for reading data from the config source, whether that is an ini file, yaml, or an external service. .. _spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130047 Point 2 is potentially tricky to handle in a way that doesn't break backwards compatibility. One possibility would be to allow referencing a separate file that would contain the more complex data structure. So you might have an opt:: cfg.JSONOpt('example', help='Filename containing JSON data') With the following files: service.conf:: example=example.json example.json:: [{"vendor_id": "8086", "product_id": "0443"}, {"vendor_id": "1234", "product_id": "5678"}] Referencing CONF.example would then return the data structure described by the JSON in the second file. Alternatives ------------ Allow mixing multiple config file formats ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ If oslo.config can support multiple backend file formats, one way to better represent complex data while maintaining compatibility with existing configs would be to simply create a separate file in the most appropriate format and put the complex opt values there. The config-dir functionality could then be used to pull in all of the values from both files. This solution will be more complex due to oslo.config needing to support multiple backend formats at the same time, and will impose new requirements on the proxy config spec that Josh proposed, but does have the advantage of allowing deployers to keep all of their complicated config options in a single file, instead of one file per option (although it's possible the JSONOpt could be written to allow putting all of the JSON values in the same file too). Replace all the things ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Universally replace the ini format with something like yaml. This would generate a huge amount of churn in configuration tools and would obsolete all existing config files. I'm personally opposed to it, but it was suggested by one of the people requesting this feature so I include it for completeness. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- There should be relatively little change in the user-visible apis, other than possibly new options such as JSONOpt if that path is taken. Otherwise this change should be made as transparent to consumers as possible. Security impact --------------- Adding more data sources introduces the possibility for security flaws to be found in any one of them, and if config data is being delivered remotely from a separate service there may be authentication and security implications. Performance Impact ------------------ Will depend on the backend in use. Reading a JSON or YAML file is likely not any slower than reading an INI file, but retrieving config over a network could take significantly longer than the existing implementation. Any such backend method should make sure to avoid repeated lookups over the network. Configuration Impact -------------------- Not necessarily a new configuration option, but a new option type would be added as part of the current proposal. Developer Impact ---------------- Should be largely transparent to users of oslo.config, except for an improved ability to represent complex configuration data. Testing Impact -------------- Since existing deployment tools use exclusively INI files for configuration this would be difficult to add to the gate. Some of the proposed features could gain additional gate testing as projects adopt them. We may need functional testing for some of the more advanced backends. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- bnemec harlowja Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Work Items ---------- Will depend on which option is chosen. Incubation ========== Not planned for incubation Adoption -------- Library ------- Anticipated API Stabilization ----------------------------- Documentation Impact ==================== Will require documentation of how to use the new backend features. The amount of work required will depend on the implementation option chosen. Dependencies ============ Possibly https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130047 References ========== https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130047 .. note:: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode

commit_message:
ovn: Create the ovn dbs only if the schema file exists

OVN has been split out from openvswitch and it's code is here [1].
With the split we have changed the ovn runtime/data dirs to
/etc/ovn and /usr/share/ovn respectively.

If a user uses latest OVN (when used after the split from
openvswitch), then the extend_start.sh of ovn-nb-db-server and
ovn-sb-db-server will fail because the OVN schema files will be in different
location (new location is /usr/share/ovn/ovn-nb.ovschema and /usr/share/ovn/ovn-sb.ovschema)

The old location is - /usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-nb.ovschema and
/usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-sb.ovschema

This patch checks for the presence of the schema files in the old location before
accessing them.

For latest OVN, it is advisable to use the "ovn-ctl" script to start
and stop OVN ovsdb-servers. ovn-citl script takes care of creating the dbs
and updating the dbs if the schema is updated.

[1] - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn
      https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/commit/f3e24610ea18eb873dc860f1710432e9aacd27fd

Change-Id: If2bab2fac5be28ae7e1cd02de13a2de94fe17bac
Closes-bug: 1849633
Signed-off-by: Numan Siddique <nusiddiq@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d1a07584ed116c3e046dc0b77370b70374a5c947)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/47/699447/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check for the presence of schema file in the old # location before accessing it. # Note: If latest OVN is used (post split from openvswitch), # then the new location for the schema file # is - /usr/share/ovn/ovn-sb.ovsschema. # It is advisable to use the ovn-ctl script to start # ovn SB db server. ovn-ctl takes care of creating the # db file from the schema file if the db file is not # present. ovn-ctl also takes care of updating the db file # if the schema file is updated. if [[ -e "/usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-sb.ovsschema" ]]; then if [[ ! -e "/var/lib/openvswitch/ovnsb.db" ]]; then ovsdb-tool create "/var/lib/openvswitch/ovnsb.db" "/usr/share/openvswitch/ovn-sb.ovsschema" fi

commit_message:
WIP: Allow different namespace and version tag of octavia container images

As part of an initiative to support running newer versions of Octavia
images on older deployments, this patch allows the namespace and version
to differ from the rest of the TripleO deployment.

Change-Id: I1b21270ee995008f63268964f14d41671f5dfb61

commit_message:
Add CephGrafana resource to the ControllerStorageNFS role

This change just adds the missing resource to include the missed
CephGrafana bits, fixing the ceph-dashboard deployment scenario.
In this review is also added a validation to make sure that both
ControllerStorage{Dashboard,Nfs} propertly inherit from Controller.

Change-Id: I0075bcb5318462555c7f9f96204ce037016f3e69
Closes-Bug: #1856060
(cherry picked from commit d8dd715d35af7ce43ee21f6813396a107196c224)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/40/698840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def validate_controller_storage_nfs(filename, tpl, exclude_service=()): control_role_filename = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(filename), './Controller.yaml') with open(control_role_filename, 'r') as f: control_role_tpl = yaml.load(f.read(), Loader=yaml.SafeLoader) control_role_services = control_role_tpl[0]['ServicesDefault'] for role in tpl: if role['name'] == 'ControllerStorageNfs': services = [x for x in role['ServicesDefault'] if (x not in exclude_service)] if sorted(services) != sorted(control_role_services): print('ERROR: ServicesDefault in %s is different from ' 'ServicesDefault in roles/Controller.yaml' % filename) return 1 return 0 if filename.startswith('./roles/ControllerStorageNfs.yaml'): exclude = [ 'OS::TripleO::Services::CephNfs'] retval |= validate_controller_storage_nfs(filename, tpl, exclude) if filename.startswith('./roles/ControllerStorageDashboard.yaml'): retval |= validate_controller_dashboard(filename, tpl)

subject: Ensure /var/log/journal exists as soon as possible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-16 07:33:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/8fc3086b8128178598758d5295482e41d583c930', 'message': 'Ensure /var/log/journal exists as soon as possible

It might happen the /var/log/journal directory doesn't exist on a host,
especially if this host is a VM (the image creation usually involves
deep cleaning of the logs).

This absence might lead to log loss with the default journald
configuration, which uses the "auto" Storage.
This "auto" means that:
- if /var/log/journal exists, journald will use it, and it will be
persistent
- if /var/log/journal doesn't exist, journald will use a volatile
location, /run/log/journal, which is dropped upon system reboot

Since logs are important, and "old" logs might be useful after a reboot,
it's better to ensure we have persistent storage for journald.

Closes-Bug: #1856278

commit_message:
Ensure /var/log/journal exists as soon as possible

It might happen the /var/log/journal directory doesn't exist on a host,
especially if this host is a VM (the image creation usually involves
deep cleaning of the logs).

This absence might lead to log loss with the default journald
configuration, which uses the "auto" Storage.
This "auto" means that:
- if /var/log/journal exists, journald will use it, and it will be
persistent
- if /var/log/journal doesn't exist, journald will use a volatile
location, /run/log/journal, which is dropped upon system reboot

Since logs are important, and "old" logs might be useful after a reboot,
it's better to ensure we have persistent storage for journald.

Closes-Bug: #1856278
Change-Id: I93dcc57aff63b91dab475b0c114b278324434e41
(cherry picked from commit I93dcc57aff63b91dab475b0c114b278324434e41)

Fix client_package for RedHat > 7 and Fedora

so using equivalent python script as wsgi source.

ip6_tables is needed for HybridFwDriver

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-17 05:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/helm/prometheus-operator.sh', 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/helm/metrics-server.sh', 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/helm/ingress-nginx.sh', 'magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/helm/prometheus-adapter.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/1ab6abb120ac2f93d29bfb7c9a5bfc0f62cf0701', 'message': 'Increase backoffLimit to 10 for helm installer

The helm installer often quickly reaches the backoffLimit of 5. Increase
this to 10 so that there is a greater chance of successful installation.

commit_message:
Increase backoffLimit to 10 for helm installer

The helm installer often quickly reaches the backoffLimit of 5. Increase
this to 10 so that there is a greater chance of successful installation.

Story: 2006765
Task: 37783

Change-Id: I5293c970bb1696f14c421fdf67abb495b4b8d666
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>
(cherry picked from commit c8752d697610df1419a326624a25826bbc0c6249)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/37/699337/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Support for Router Scheduling on addition/removal of chassis

The following patch provides L3HA Rescheduling of gateways when chassis
are added/removed. It reschedules the gateway ports when a new chassis
is added/old one removed. However, the number of chassis where a
gateway can be hosted is limited by the constant MAX_GW_CHASSIS.

Co-Authored-By: Maciej Józefczyk <mjozefcz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I0d96efe4ceef4168039930738285c19d5c003951
Closes-Bug: #1762691
(cherry picked from commit 12070403db4851ef73011c52124cd335b6807521)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/52/698252/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
[k8s] Deprecate heapster

Replace heapster for metrics-server as cluster default.
This requires the following labels as default:
tiller_enabled=true
heapster_enabled=false
metrics_server_enabled=true

depends-on: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953
depends-on: Icd7f380d87672c00257e34df385d81e1c3e36ddf

Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

Remove legacy-storyboard-js-integration jobs

Remove these jobs, they are not used anymore.

commit_message:
Remove Python 2.7 support from testing and gates

Makes Python 3 the base python for all tox venvs and removes
py2 jobs from zuul.yaml.

Remaining:
- move the legacy gate jobs from openstack-zuul-jobs to the os-brick
  repo and make them py3 jobs
- adjust setup.cfg to require py3 and remove py2 requirements from
  test-requirements.txt and doc/requirements.txt

Partial-bug: #1853372

Change-Id: Ib447656aa213914bafd50380b3821090f93776f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/74/697374/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: minversion = 3.1.0skip_missing_interpreters = true # python runtimes: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/ussuri.html envlist = py37,py36,pep8 # this allows tox to infer the base python from the environment name # and override any basepython configured in this file ignore_basepython_conflict=truebasepython = python3# call example: 'tox -epy37 -- --concurrency=4'
deleted_lines: minversion = 2.0 envlist = py27,py37,pep8# call ie: 'tox -epy27 -- --concurrency=4'basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Ignore devices with OSError

This bug handles OSError when trying to read from CDrom devices with no
disc in the is_pristine_disk function which makes the run-action
list-disks to fail.

Change-Id: I951897a699305604821f2c910ee9ea91582c4e40
Closes-Bug: #1833857
Co-authored-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <skatsaounis@admin.grnet.gr>
Signed-off-by: Alexandros Soumplis <soumplis@admin.grnet.gr>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charms.ceph refs/changes/04/699404/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: f = open(dev, 'rb') except OSError as e: log(e) return False

commit_message:
[neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the system
has no way to reach some IP addresses.

Increasing threshold limits addresses the situation, in a reasonably
safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM used).

More context on this issue:

* http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1780348
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1488938
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690087
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/0583a0c94996df6b784229e8a534f955eaca85bc
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/3dd21ea62ac152e40bfdfee4b8e25a528c82a79f
* https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1651a1805a16212299fe0a91aebb2a91ed39bc6e

Change-Id: I60c871e8eb9f2c086818ff077987f2390930800c
Closes-Bug: #1844349
(cherry picked from commit 4234cc4b5b3ca7172c9d184ed3f145b955f11163)

commit_message:
[neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the system
has no way to reach some IP addresses.

Increasing threshold limits addresses the situation, in a reasonably
safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM used).

More context on this issue:

* http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1780348
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1488938
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1690087
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/0583a0c94996df6b784229e8a534f955eaca85bc
* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/3dd21ea62ac152e40bfdfee4b8e25a528c82a79f
* https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1651a1805a16212299fe0a91aebb2a91ed39bc6e

Change-Id: I60c871e8eb9f2c086818ff077987f2390930800c
Closes-Bug: #1844349
(cherry picked from commit 4234cc4b5b3ca7172c9d184ed3f145b955f11163)

commit_message:
Fix tox environments

Since python-cloudkittyclient is now part of the global requirements,
the upstream requirements file can't be used anymore. This removes the
upper constraints in tox environments and adds cliff to the doc
dependencies.

Change-Id: Id97415eb94ca9a19e3fcd4c0988038b329568e3d

commit_message:
[neutron] Adjust neighbour table thresholds

When clouds have a large number of hosts, the default size of the ARP
cache is too small. The cache can overflow, which means that the system
has no way to reach some IP addresses.

Increasing threshold limits addresses the situation, in a reasonably
safe way (the maximum impact is 5MB or so of additional RAM used).

More context on this issue:

* http://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/arp.7.html
* https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1780348

* https://github.com/crowbar/crowbar-openstack/commit/0583a0c94996df6b784229e8a534f955eaca85bc

commit_message:
CiscoNexus: Update and Remove deprecated vars

Update and Remove deprecated variables from Cisco Nexus Config.
* Deprecated variables include vlan_name_prefix, svi_round_robin,
  provider_vlan_name_prefix, persistent_switch_config,
  never_cache_ssh_connection, ssh_port, switch_replay_count,
  nexus_driver, and host_key_checks.
* Change config replay to on by defaulting switch_heartbeat_time=30.
* Replaced method of configurating host_ports_mapping config.

Depends-On: Iee2f869c4054f1120d224994aba8c827f981e6c0
Change-Id: Ibda17afdcf7a6748f15390fd8a0a8b70bb6dfc2b
Closes-bug:  #1793381
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/58/606958/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: NetworkNexusVlanNamePrefix: type: string description: > This configuration item is OBSOLETE. A short prefix to prepend to the VLAN name default: 'q-' NetworkNexusSviRoundRobin: type: boolean description: > This configuration item is OBSOLETE. A flag to enable round robin scheduling default: false NetworkNexusProviderVlanNamePrefix: type: string description: > This configuration item is OBSOLETE. A short prefix to prepend to the VLAN name. default: 'p-' NetworkNexusPersistentSwitchConfig: type: string description: > This config item will be deprecated. To make Nexus device persistent. default: false NetworkNexusNeverCacheSshConnection: type: string description: > This config item will be deprecated. Prevent Cache of ssh connection default: false NetworkNexusSwitchReplayCount: type: number description: > This configuration item is OBSOLETE. The Nexus driver replay behavior is to continue to attempt to connect to the down Nexus device with a period equal to the heartbeat time interval. This was previously the Number of times to attempt config replay. default: 3 NetworkNexusCfgDriver: type: string description: > This will be deprecated. Lower-level configuration driver which sends commands to the Nexus Device. Choices are 'restapi' or 'ncclient' where the latter is being deprecated. So there is no longer a need for this variable. default: 'restapi' NetworkNexusHostKeyChecks: type: boolean description: > This config item will be deprecated. It enables strict host key checks when connecting to Nexus switches default: false neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::vlan_name_prefix: {get_input: NexusVlanNamePrefix} neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::svi_round_robin: {get_input: NexusSviRoundRobin} neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::provider_vlan_name_prefix: {get_input: NexusProviderVlanNamePrefix} neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::persistent_switch_config: {get_input: NexusPersistentSwitchConfig} neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::never_cache_ssh_connection: {get_input: NexusNeverCacheSshConnection} neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::switch_replay_count: {get_input: NexusSwitchReplayCount} neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::nexus_driver: {get_input: NexusCfgDriver} neutron::plugins::ml2::cisco::nexus::host_key_checks: {get_input: NexusHostKeyChecks} NexusVlanNamePrefix: {get_param: NetworkNexusVlanNamePrefix} NexusSviRoundRobin: {get_param: NetworkNexusSviRoundRobin} NexusProviderVlanNamePrefix: {get_param: NetworkNexusProviderVlanNamePrefix} NexusPersistentSwitchConfig: {get_param: NetworkNexusPersistentSwitchConfig} NexusNeverCacheSshConnection: {get_param: NetworkNexusNeverCacheSshConnection} NexusSwitchReplayCount: {get_param: NetworkNexusSwitchReplayCount} NexusCfgDriver: {get_param: NetworkNexusCfgDriver} NexusHostKeyChecks: {get_param: NetworkNexusHostKeyChecks}

commit_message:
CiscoNexus: Update and Remove deprecated vars

Update and Remove deprecated variables from Cisco Nexus Config.
* Deprecated variables include vlan_name_prefix, svi_round_robin,
  provider_vlan_name_prefix, persistent_switch_config,
  never_cache_ssh_connection, ssh_port, switch_replay_count,
  nexus_driver, and host_key_checks.
* Change config replay to on by defaulting switch_heartbeat_time=30.
* Replaced method of configurating host_ports_mapping config.

Change-Id: Iee2f869c4054f1120d224994aba8c827f981e6c0
Closes-bug:  #1793379

commit_message:
[k8s] Update metrics-server

Magnum allows to use CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to specify a local
repository from which we can pull container images. This repository
defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Add label metrics_server_chart_tag to allow user to specify
stable/metrics-server chart tag to use
* Add label metrics_server_enabled to allow enable/disable of
component (defaults: true)

Story: 2004816
Task: 37390

Change-Id: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit df52f9c9ea08b67158491583d47a8a10113de129)

commit_message:
Correct power state handling for managed in-band inspection

Do not try to configure networks when powered on, unless it's a node
with a SmartNIC, in which case do power on before configuring networks.

A new helper is created based on existing code in agent.py.

Change-Id: I3a8fab7a39b604ed17a690fa9c31b3cd1dbdc6a7
Story: #1528920
Task: #37753

commit_message:
Make sure glance_api_tls_proxy logs are persisted on the host

The logs for the glance_api_tls_proxy containers are not persisted on
the host and hence get lost at the restart of the container.  Said
container has httpd inside of it so we need to make sure that the httpd
logs are persisted on the host just like the other containers that use
httpd.

Tested this review and I correctly get the logs persisted on a
TLS-everywhere environment:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/glance/
total 1040
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   5864 Nov 28 10:07 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 544043 Nov 28 11:17 glance-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   4360 Nov 28 10:07 glance-api-proxy_error_ssl.log

NB: Slight conflict on deployment/glance/glance-api-logging-file-container.yaml

Change-Id: Id4f24e171867adc445eca55b3908360c8f3f6f30
Closes-Bug: #1854343
(cherry picked from commit f22dce44779a3b2d0f08c991d388b2c55829664a)
(cherry picked from commit a764b832e2fc17bd3087d08c129a3b53d2bf083b)
(cherry picked from commit 53465f7f298af33bd0404ed10af09f76b7eab0d8)
(cherry picked from commit cc98ad60ef1181bf0c0582c081022fa4b4592ec2)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-17 07:15:10.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/neutron-api.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/3c1f10d331444875b3a9bbfa5c052e3ecb124d2d', 'message': "Fix neutron api TLS logging

This is a partial cherry pick (logging part) of
Ia1c22b8981fb735a052707516f73313c4e5ca93c

Namely it is the second part of the commit only:
B) The logging in the neutron_server_tls_proxy container is not persisted to the host

Before:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
[root@controller-0 ~]#

After:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
total 136
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   400 Nov 15 17:43 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 72784 Nov 15 17:53 neutron-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root  2748 Nov 15 17:43 neutron-api-proxy_error_ssl.log
[root@controller-0 ~]#

We backport only the logging bit because this needs to be fixed all the
way to queens which did not have the ovn-tls work from Kamil.
(I should have split this neutron api TLS fixes in two commits in the

commit_message:
Fix neutron api TLS logging

This is a partial cherry pick (logging part) of
Ia1c22b8981fb735a052707516f73313c4e5ca93c
Closes-Bug: #1852779

Namely it is the second part of the commit only:
B) The logging in the neutron_server_tls_proxy container is not persisted to the host

Before:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
[root@controller-0 ~]#

After:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
total 136
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   400 Nov 15 17:43 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 72784 Nov 15 17:53 neutron-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root  2748 Nov 15 17:43 neutron-api-proxy_error_ssl.log
[root@controller-0 ~]#

We backport only the logging bit because this needs to be fixed all the
way to queens which did not have the ovn-tls work from Kamil.
(I should have split this neutron api TLS fixes in two commits in the
first place, but it's too late for that)

(cherry-picked from 0aecbc772384ae4623fe2013c1698825f268e16b)
Change-Id: Id9b9a15d40467507bdeace56be55b63a6298b560
(cherry picked from commit 0aaae842beee2468fb726aa92faa8b53d7266a9c)

commit_message:
Properly set loopback_users via rabbitmq::loopback_users

Sorta resurrecting https://review.opendev.org/#/c/324016/ now that
https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/pull/699 merged.

This commit prevents a duplicate entry for loopback_users in the
rabbitmq.config file:

{loopback_users, [<<"guest">>]},
{loopback_users, []},

keeping only the expected empty array.

Change-Id: I0c291bf5611f02983c430179206556bae3b38736
(cherry picked from commit 04a5937e1f1482dd3115ddc809c555abea87e69d)

commit_message:
Ensure namespace are recreated upon a k8s client failure

If k8s client is not responsive after the neutron resources for a
namespace are generated a rollback action will be triggered. However
if during that rollback action the k8s is still not accessible, only
the neutron resources will be deleted and the k8s ones will be left
behind, blocking the recreation of the needed neutron resources

Change-Id: I3500b11717f6eeeb5b5686a25f085d26900aa434
Closes-Bug: 1856000

commit_message:
Derive Pci passthrough whitelist disable option

This change is to add the option to disable the derive
pci passthrough whitelist automation logic in sriov
deployments if required.

Change-Id: Ib2d5b019e3064acf50c06da071d9eb77fe0d10dd
Closes-Bug: #1841041
(cherry picked from commit 227c516aa2d7de60cec2cc2a77b74221b4c7bc4a)

defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Add label metrics_server_chart_tag to allow user to specify
stable/metrics-server chart tag to use
* Add label metrics_server_enabled to allow enable/disable of
component (defaults: true)

Story: 2004816

Change-Id: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953

commit_message:
[k8s] Update metrics-server

Magnum allows to use CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to specify a local
repository from which we can pull container images. This repository
defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Add label metrics_server_chart_tag to allow user to specify
stable/metrics-server chart tag to use
* Add label metrics_server_enabled to allow enable/disable of
component (defaults: true)

Story: 2004816
Task: 37390

Change-Id: Idc315937a82317b76349bbe8466d900d00194953
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/39/637939/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
actions/ansible: catch errors when cleaning the work directory

If an error happens during the cleaning of the work directory, we now
catch the error and return the error to Mistral.

Change-Id: Id037525650c9976cd88a8ba2a02b206ec03855aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/34/699234/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace ostempest job in favor of plain standalone

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-os-tempest was added while porting
tripleo ci jobs to os_tempest and now the porting is done.

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-os-tempest and
tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone are the same job, It replaces the
existing os_tempest job to plain tripleo standalone job to keep
consistency at all places.

tripleo-ci-centos-7-standalone-os-tempest definition should be kept
as itis since it is used for stable branches in some projects.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/697973
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/697974
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/697975
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/697989

Change-Id: I8044aa3f96527d2e7039841ef368ff6a8fff7564
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure leftover LBaaS are deleted upon Controller start

When the deletion of a SVC is triggered while the load balancer
is still creating and the controller restarts, the deletion
event will be gone and the lbaas remains. This commit fixes
the issue, by removing the leftover lbaas upon controller restart.

Change-Id: I2d7dd14c3f05b0b1da6db7ac9b58731e34b593e6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/74/695674/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from kuryr_kubernetes.controller.drivers import utils as driver_utils self._cleanup_leftover_lbaas() def _cleanup_leftover_lbaas(self): lbaas_client = clients.get_loadbalancer_client() loadbalancers = lbaas_client.load_balancers() services = driver_utils.get_services().get('items') services_dict = {'{}/{}'.format( service['metadata']['namespace'], service['metadata']['name']): service for service in services} for loadbalancer in loadbalancers: if not services_dict.get(loadbalancer.name): self._drv_lbaas.release_loadbalancer(loadbalancer)

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ib07a6a5287b27a15efe7ef9b218c50fabedda674
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-cli refs/changes/63/699263/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: Ifeef4c911d53a7ce216548bf5baea1719a068e80
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Swift Global Cluster

This patchset adds a support for Swift Global Cluster feature as
described at:

https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/overview_global_cluster.html

It allows specifying affinity settings as parrt of the deployment.
Moreover, the master - slave relation is introduced for the purpose of
rings distribution across proxy nodes participating in the Swift Global
Cluster.

Change-Id: I406445493e2226aa5ae40a09c9053ac8633a46e9
Closes-Bug: 1815879
Depends-On: I11b6c7802e5bfbd61b06e4d11c65804a165781b6

commit_message:
Fix Train release notes

These are mostly formatting fixes, but also a correction of the default
value of pip_upper_constraints_file.

Change-Id: Iadb1b45644865d67e170f94d301d3eeeab2654ee

commit_message:
Swift Global Cluster

This patchset adds a support for Swift Global Cluster feature as
described at:

https://docs.openstack.org/swift/latest/overview_global_cluster.html

It allows specifying 'region' config option as part of the deployment.
Theregion is reflected later on in the Swift rings.

Change-Id: I11b6c7802e5bfbd61b06e4d11c65804a165781b6
Partial-Bug: 1815879
Needed-By: I406445493e2226aa5ae40a09c9053ac8633a46e9

added_lines: import fileinput 'swift-account', 'swift-account-auditor', 'swift-account-reaper' ] ACCOUNT_SVCS_REP = [ 'swift-account-replicator' 'swift-container', 'swift-container-auditor', 'swift-container-updater',CONTAINER_SVCS_REP = [ 'swift-container-replicator'OBJECT_SVCS = [ 'swift-object', 'swift-object-auditor', 'swift-object-reconstructor', 'swift-object-updater' ] OBJECT_SVCS_REP = [ 'swift-object-replicator' ] SWIFT_SVCS = ( ACCOUNT_SVCS + ACCOUNT_SVCS_REP + CONTAINER_SVCS + CONTAINER_SVCS_REP + OBJECT_SVCS + OBJECT_SVCS_REP ) '/etc/swift/account-server/1.conf': ACCOUNT_SVCS, '/etc/swift/account-server/2.conf': ACCOUNT_SVCS_REP, '/etc/swift/container-server/1.conf': CONTAINER_SVCS, '/etc/swift/container-server/2.conf': CONTAINER_SVCS_REP, '/etc/swift/object-server/1.conf': OBJECT_SVCS, '/etc/swift/object-server/2.conf': OBJECT_SVCS_REP, '/etc/swift/swift.conf': SWIFT_SVCSSWIFT_ACCOUNT_CONF_DIR = os.path.join(SWIFT_CONF_DIR, 'account-server') SWIFT_CONTAINER_CONF_DIR = os.path.join(SWIFT_CONF_DIR, 'container-server') SWIFT_OBJECT_CONF_DIR = os.path.join(SWIFT_CONF_DIR, 'object-server') SWIFT_ACCOUNT_CONF_DIR, SWIFT_CONTAINER_CONF_DIR, SWIFT_OBJECT_CONF_DIR, for server in ['account', 'container', 'object']: configs.register('/etc/swift/%s-server/1.conf' % server, [SwiftStorageServerContext(), context.BindHostContext(), context.WorkerConfigContext(), vaultlocker.VaultKVContext( vaultlocker.VAULTLOCKER_BACKEND)]), for server in ['account', 'container', 'object']: configs.register('/etc/swift/%s-server/2.conf' % server,def adjust_default_configuration_files(): """ Adjusts default configuration files for storage nodes (lp1815879) Removes default configuration files and creates the following: /etc/swift/account-server/2.conf # account-replicator service /etc/swift/account-server/1.conf # remaining account services /etc/swift/container-server/2.conf # container-replicator service /etc/swift/container-server/1.conf # remaining container services /etc/swift/object-server/2.conf # object-replicator service /etc/swift/object-server/1.conf # remaining object services :raises: FileNotFoundError """ service_management_systems = { 'upstart': { 'config_dir': '/etc/init', 'filename_suffix': '.conf' }, 'sysvinit': { 'config_dir': '/etc/init.d', 'filename_suffix': '' } } swift_init('all', 'stop') for file in [os.path.join(SWIFT_CONF_DIR, 'account-server.conf'), os.path.join(SWIFT_CONF_DIR, 'container-server.conf'), os.path.join(SWIFT_CONF_DIR, 'object-server.conf')]: if os.path.isfile(file): check_call(['rm', file]) else: log("{} does not exists, skipping.".format(file), level=DEBUG) for file in [os.path.join(SWIFT_ACCOUNT_CONF_DIR, '1.conf'), os.path.join(SWIFT_ACCOUNT_CONF_DIR, '2.conf'), os.path.join(SWIFT_CONTAINER_CONF_DIR, '1.conf'), os.path.join(SWIFT_CONTAINER_CONF_DIR, '2.conf'), os.path.join(SWIFT_OBJECT_CONF_DIR, '1.conf'), os.path.join(SWIFT_OBJECT_CONF_DIR, '2.conf')]: if (os.path.isdir(SWIFT_ACCOUNT_CONF_DIR) and os.path.isdir(SWIFT_CONTAINER_CONF_DIR) and os.path.isdir(SWIFT_OBJECT_CONF_DIR)): check_call(['touch', file]) check_call(['chmod', '0644', file]) else: log("Cannot create {} file. Directory does not exist".format(file), level=DEBUG) for service in SWIFT_SVCS: for system, attrs in service_management_systems.items(): filename = service + attrs['filename_suffix'] config_file = os.path.join(attrs['config_dir'], filename) if 'account' in service: old_filename = 'account-server.conf' new_conf_dir = SWIFT_ACCOUNT_CONF_DIR elif 'container' in service: old_filename = 'container-server.conf' new_conf_dir = SWIFT_CONTAINER_CONF_DIR elif 'object' in service: old_filename = 'object-server.conf' new_conf_dir = SWIFT_OBJECT_CONF_DIR if 'replicator' in service: new_filename = '2.conf' else: new_filename = '1.conf' old_file = os.path.join(SWIFT_CONF_DIR, old_filename) new_file = os.path.join(new_conf_dir, new_filename) try: for line in fileinput.input(config_file, inplace=True): print(line.replace(old_file, new_file), end='') except FileNotFoundError: log("Cannot open {} file".format(config_file), level=DEBUG) check_call(['systemctl', 'daemon-reload'])

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-ironic-inspector-client is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I8cc4589378e8e7cac860080be1099cbb79b4a6e5

This guide has not seen many changes, add a note to explain that it is
not accurate anymore.

added_lines: .. important:: The OpenStack Operations Guide was published in 2014, the last partial update was in 2017. Since then it has seen some minor updates to document newer releases and fix broken links. The guide thus might not apply anymore to current releases.

commit_message:
Synchronise with kayobe-config for Train

Synchronises the configuration with kayobe-config prior to creating a
stable/train branch.

This commit also defines the Ceph and Swift storage networks, which had
been skipped in the Stein sync.

Change-Id: I67521122e8a87b2e0637e8f671c3fbc0b8f0fbb5

commit_message:
Add "idp-discovery-service-url" option

Allow the usage of an IDP discovery service for multiple IDPs.
Make use of "MellonDiscoveryURL" option in "mod_auth_mellon"
Apache module.

Change-Id: I2eed6dc3c57a51ed12f8ca4b31b46a13bc8fa911
Signed-off-by: Yanos Angelopoulos <yanos@admin.grnet.gr>

commit_message:
Delegate and run once debug start-at-task messages

Instead of executing these debug tasks for every host, we can delegate
them to localhost and only run them once.

Change-Id: I367db4c9e743c77f121751ecca6bb4996b8a3df9
(cherry picked from commit a85d3d7069b2df9e991fc1061d34d92c1998469a)

commit_message:
Explicitly disable DVR for OVN HA deployment

DVR is set as default by [1]. For non-DVR deployments
we need to explicitly disable it.
To have flat naming convention we decided to rename
neutron-ovn-ha.yaml template to neutron-ovn-non-dvr-ha.yaml.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/593056/
Co-Authored-By: Eran Kuris <ekuris@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia362e63927523a10433d247b86cb1a1c35233582

subject: Retry the connection to heat-api when 500 code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-12-13 13:01:52.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/tests/test_utils.py', 'tripleoclient/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/70b28932fda9135cb340d500d1dcf3ed2bdfc0b5', 'message': "Retry the connection to heat-api when 500 code

In a rare case like httpd reload by logrotate, heat-api returns
500 code. If this happens, trpleoclient can't get the status of
the stack even though the process is still on-going.

To handle this situation, tipleoclient should retry when it can't
get the stack information by 500 code.

Change-Id: I97a6825f4ff9f125eb597e5b7bd0c553c37e49e7
Closes-Bug: #1855633
(cherry picked from commit 932fc6755a8315ccde2e90848ad3224f1fe16735)
"}]
commit_message:
Retry the connection to heat-api when 500 code

In a rare case like httpd reload by logrotate, heat-api returns
500 code. If this happens, trpleoclient can't get the status of
the stack even though the process is still on-going.

To handle this situation, tipleoclient should retry when it can't
get the stack information by 500 code.

Change-Id: I97a6825f4ff9f125eb597e5b7bd0c553c37e49e7
Closes-Bug: #1855633
(cherry picked from commit 932fc6755a8315ccde2e90848ad3224f1fe16735)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/03/698903/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Quote output values for overcloudrc

If the overcloudrc values have spaces, we need to quote them to ensure
it gets parsed correctly.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/699010/
Change-Id: I06995dee0ec7eabda16793aa42cae7197c4959f5
Closes-Bug: #1854868
(cherry picked from commit 5d44457ae16ebb3298143e04dbf0c0c5e5249553)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/83/697483/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: # py3 from shlex import quote except ImportError: # py2 from pipes import quote line = "export %(key)s=%(value)s\n" % {'key': key, 'value': quote(value)}

'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2019-11-13 16:23:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/commit/72ce50ed1355281530a945e70fa85d34c3122723', 'message': 'TripleO Validator CLI Refactor

This patch hardly refactors the TripleO Validator CLI. The 'List'
subcommand has been split in different new subcommands which does "one
thing and only one thing". It also adds the support for the TripleO
history file and integrates better the CLI with the openstack client
library, which simplifies it a lot.

The subcommands are:

- To display the full list of validations or by group(s):
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator list
  ```

- To display full details about one validation:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show
  ```

- To display the available parameters for one or multiple validations,
  export them in a JSON or YAML file:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show parameter
  ```

- To display full details about the groups used by the validations:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator group info
  ```

- To run one or several validations by names or by groups:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator run
  ```

Depends-On: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
Change-Id: I09e2cba484d3a91915fb9294bc351b5d7f3aca0f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

The subcommands are:

- To display the full list of validations or by group(s):
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator list
  ```

- To display full details about one validation:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show
  ```

- To display the available parameters for one or multiple validations,
  export them in a JSON or YAML file:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show parameter
  ```

- To display full details about the groups used by the validations:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator group info
  ```

- To run one or several validations by names or by groups:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator run
  ```

Depends-On: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
Change-Id: I09e2cba484d3a91915fb9294bc351b5d7f3aca0f

commit_message:
TripleO Validator CLI Refactor

This patch hardly refactors the TripleO Validator CLI. The 'List'
subcommand has been split in different new subcommands which does "one
thing and only one thing". It also adds the support for the TripleO
history file and integrates better the CLI with the openstack client
library, which simplifies it a lot.

The subcommands are:

- To display the full list of validations or by group(s):
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator list
  ```

- To display full details about one validation:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show
  ```

- To display the available parameters for one or multiple validations,
  export them in a JSON or YAML file:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator show parameter
  ```

- To display full details about the groups used by the validations:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator group info
  ```

- To run one or several validations by names or by groups:
  ```
  $ openstack tripleo validator run
  ```

Depends-On: I56b9d39c113cfb30695fe8cf2740ae147b0dd3e4
Change-Id: I09e2cba484d3a91915fb9294bc351b5d7f3aca0f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/52/693552/19 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use olso to parse size strings

This uses oslo.utils size parser instead of implementing our own.  The
only intentional difference here is that a number with no units is an
error (it seems more likely that you've forgotten the units than you
really want to specify things in bytes).

Change-Id: Iecb1ad5bee1619202a41e9d9707db3bc744dd239
Depends-On: I772bcb6651484d68afabd1965e5db033439c6257

commit_message:
Don't use hasattr to lazy-load properties

This is a better pattern overall and most classes
has already had this changed as part of the service
refactor.

Change-Id: Ia6fb1f78a449bee48b9e4c86ca1334d0b28b28ef

commit_message:
Add dib_selinux_enabled var to disable selinux rhel8 image builds

For related-bug we need to disable selinux for rhel8 image build
This adds a new dib_selinux_enabled var to oooci-build-images role
defaulting to false. Testing at [1]

Related-Bug: 1853028
[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/23919/
Change-Id: I9004b0cba1dbd8d92db24369ed04351164e85766

subject: Update test_port_list_filter_by_ip pass conditions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-08-16 03:51:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/7799c947457af97e1d006245a164a2c38b436688', 'message': "Update test_port_list_filter_by_ip pass conditions

Currently this test fails if matching ports are returned from more than
one tenant. This isn't really an error. This patchset updates the pass
assertions to only check that the created port is in the list of ports
returned, and that every port returned has a matching fixed IP.

Change-Id: Ia20af71d031504aa08fc0ea92fd35cbc408edba3
Closes-Bug: #1840401
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-08-18 03:02:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/4db5f7915c51b0722d7d95e9a4a5a48747239013', 'message': 'Update test_port_list_filter_by_ip pass conditions

Currently this test fails if matching ports are returned from more than
one tenant. This response is valid if the account has the admin role.

This patchset updates the pass assertions to only check that the created
port is in the list of ports returned, and that every port returned has
a matching fixed IP.

Change-Id: Ia20af71d031504aa08fc0ea92fd35cbc408edba3
Closes-Bug: #1840401
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-08-18 11:40:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/9a7105c7668e7053866e8662c183d13cf23bfb5f', 'message': 'Update test_port_list_filter_by_ip pass conditions

Change-Id: Ia20af71d031504aa08fc0ea92fd35cbc408edba3
Closes-Bug: #1840401
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-08-22 12:06:14.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/6eba7e69d13c8c39acc7e5c4742d67e243073325', 'message': 'Update test_port_list_filter_by_ip pass conditions

Currently this test fails if matching ports are returned from more than
one tenant. This response is valid if the account has the admin role. In
addition, the test does not properly validate that the filtering is
working. Even if the full unfiltered list of ports were returned, the
test would pass.

This patchset updates the pass assertions to only check that the created
port is in the list of ports returned, and that every port returned has
a matching fixed IP.

Change-Id: Ia20af71d031504aa08fc0ea92fd35cbc408edba3
Closes-Bug: #1840401
'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2019-08-22 18:34:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/d3009d7a7a9fbc427e76f210316ea96dbfa9c619', 'message': 'Update test_port_list_filter_by_ip pass conditions

Currently this test fails if matching ports are returned from more than
one tenant. This response is valid if the account has the admin role. In
addition, the test does not properly validate that the filtering is
working. Even if the full unfiltered list of ports were returned, the
test would pass.

This patchset updates the pass assertions to only check that the created
port is in the list of ports returned, and that every port returned has

commit_message:
Update test_port_list_filter_by_ip pass conditions

This patchset updates the pass assertions to check that the created
port is in the list of ports returned, and that every port returned
has a matching fixed IP.

The check that all the ports in the response are from a single tenant
is retained, so this test is expected to sometimes fail if run with
admin credentials.

Change-Id: Ia20af71d031504aa08fc0ea92fd35cbc408edba3
Partial-Bug: #1840401
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/52/676852/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check that we got the desired port, and that every port in the # returned list has a fixed_ip that matches the query for addr in fixed_ips: port_ips = [port['ip_address'] for port in addr] self.assertIn(port_1_fixed_ip, port_ips)
deleted_lines: # Check that we got the desired port tenant_ids = set([port['tenant_id'] for port in ports]) self.assertEqual(len(tenant_ids), 1, 'Ports from multiple tenants are in the list resp') port_ips = [] for addr in fixed_ips: port_ips.extend([port['ip_address'] for port in addr]) port_net_ids = [port['network_id'] for port in ports] self.assertIn(port_1_fixed_ip, port_ips) self.assertIn(network['id'], port_net_ids)

commit_message:
Fix neutron api TLS logging

This is a partial cherry pick (logging part) of
Ia1c22b8981fb735a052707516f73313c4e5ca93c
Closes-Bug: #1852779

Namely it is the second part of the commit only:
B) The logging in the neutron_server_tls_proxy container is not persisted to the host

Before:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
[root@controller-0 ~]#

After:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/neutron-api/
total 136
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   400 Nov 15 17:43 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 72784 Nov 15 17:53 neutron-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root  2748 Nov 15 17:43 neutron-api-proxy_error_ssl.log
[root@controller-0 ~]#

We backport only the logging bit because this needs to be fixed all the
way to queens which did not have the ovn-tls work from Kamil.
(I should have split this neutron api TLS fixes in two commits in the
first place, but it's too late for that)

(cherry-picked from 0aecbc772384ae4623fe2013c1698825f268e16b)
Change-Id: Id9b9a15d40467507bdeace56be55b63a6298b560

commit_message:
Make sure glance_api_tls_proxy logs are persisted on the host

The logs for the glance_api_tls_proxy containers are not persisted on
the host and hence get lost at the restart of the container.  Said
container has httpd inside of it so we need to make sure that the httpd
logs are persisted on the host just like the other containers that use
httpd.

Tested this review and I correctly get the logs persisted on a
TLS-everywhere environment:
[root@controller-0 ~]# ls -l /var/log/containers/httpd/glance/
total 1040
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   5864 Nov 28 10:07 error_log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root 544043 Nov 28 11:17 glance-api-proxy_access_ssl.log
-rw-r--r--. 1 root root   4360 Nov 28 10:07 glance-api-proxy_error_ssl.log

NB: Slight conflict on deployment/glance/glance-api-logging-file-container.yaml

Change-Id: Id4f24e171867adc445eca55b3908360c8f3f6f30
Closes-Bug: #1854343
(cherry picked from commit f22dce44779a3b2d0f08c991d388b2c55829664a)
(cherry picked from commit a764b832e2fc17bd3087d08c129a3b53d2bf083b)
(cherry picked from commit 53465f7f298af33bd0404ed10af09f76b7eab0d8)

commit_message:
Install suitable service_providers

If we wants VPN works on CentOS, we can set IPSEC_PACKAGE
to libreswan, but vpn service_providers still related
to strongswan.

This patch set the value of NEUTRON_VPNAAS_SERVICE_PROVIDER
according to IPSEC_PACKAGE in devstack/settings.

Change-Id: I893a191a8a1aa5a5beb8a73a9df4d1df2fb0c2f8

Nova attaches the virtio-rng-pci device to VMs. virtio-rng-pci is a

commit_message:
Install rng-tools in Red Hat family distro images

Make sure rngd, a hardware RNG entropy gatherer daemon, is installed on
all DIB-built Red Hat family distro images. rngd comes installed by
default in a typical base installation as it's proven to help speed
things up.

Nova attaches the virtio-rng-pci device to VMs. virtio-rng-pci is a
device that provides feed random data. However, it is of little to no
use if the virtual machine is not configured to make use of given
device. That is where rngd can help by facilitating entropy to the pool
from virtio-rng-pci.

$ openstack image set --property hw_rng_model=virtio [...]
$ openstack flavor set --property hw_rng:allowed=True [...]

DIB-built minimal images do not come with rngd installed. This patch
makes sure the daemon is installed. Its systemd service comes already
enabled.

Change-Id: I34a989dbfc57d4c98113ac25c81dfb500945ff0a

commit_message:
OvS DPDK parameters failing in NIC Partitioning

This change is to fix the finding DPDK device name issue in
OvS DPDK derive parameters logic. Currently mistral fails to
derive OvS DPDK parameters in NIC Partitioning and getting
error 'Unable to determine NUMA node for DPDK NIC:'

Change-Id: I8dfc2494d35d5fce52d573f9edcafbe11ab7faac
Closes-Bug: #1855159
(cherry picked from commit 9641cc2ccb9d6bc5757f2bb888b374dedc2d2733)

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ie141d061ec000aabb1c96134ed64f0a90284f8a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/50/646850/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ia5912b4f6b1e2a0b9205087e3b489230c1292bdb

commit_message:
[wip] shortcut pip-and-virtualenv for later redhat distros

just use the packaged versions

Change-Id: Id9c8117534b9d98e35d2e4058a9be0cbe9434d1b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/20/639220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Shortcut for later distros; just use inbuilt packages but link # the *2 versions back to unversioned names as a lot of things # assume that's the case if [[ $DISTRO_NAME =~ (fedora|rhel) ]]; then ln -s /usr/bin/pip2 /usr/local/bin/pip ln -s /usr/bin/virtualenv-2 /usr/local/bin/virtualenv exit 0 fi

commit_message:
doc: Avoid duplicated entries in toctree

TOC shows duplicated entries from guides.rst now.
Titles in guides.rst and toctree entries in guides.rst
are duplicated. This commit converts titles in guides.rst
to a list to avoid it.

This change also improves the structure of the "Guides" section
in the PDF docs by not using titles in guides.rst and moving
the (hidden) toctree to the bottom of guides.rst.

Change-Id: I2985743116760fc4503d3f63ae83324be356c8d6

added_lines: Run :doc:`OpenStack in a VM <guides/single-vm>`. The VMs launched in your cloud will be slow as they are running in QEMU (emulation), but it is useful if you don't have spare hardware laying around. :doc:`[Read] <guides/single-vm>` Run :doc:`OpenStack on dedicated hardware <guides/single-machine>` This can include a server-class machine or a laptop at home. :doc:`[Read] <guides/single-machine>` Run :doc:`OpenStack in a LXC container <guides/lxc>`. Beneficial for intermediate and advanced users. The VMs launched in this cloud will be fully accelerated but not all OpenStack features are supported. :doc:`[Read] <guides/lxc>` Setup a :doc:`multi-node cluster <guides/multinode-lab>` with dedicated VLANs for VMs & Management. :doc:`[Read] <guides/multinode-lab>` Building a DevStack cluster with :doc:`Neutron Networking <guides/neutron>`. This guide is meant for building lab environments with a dedicated control node and multiple compute nodes. Procedure to setup :doc:`DevStack with KVM-based Nested Virtualization <guides/devstack-with-nested-kvm>`. With this setup, Nova instances will be more performant than with plain QEMU emulation. Guide to working with nova features :doc:`Nova and devstack <guides/nova>`. Guide to setting up :doc:`DevStack with LDAP <guides/devstack-with-ldap>`.

commit_message:
Blacklist bandit 1.6.0 due to directory exclusion bug

Bandit 1.6.0 introduces a regression[0] with the -x option,
a fix is expected to be included in 1.6.1 soon.

[0] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/488
[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/489

Change-Id: Ifc8cd18de834952b9ed9fca6d5df15dd08383642

commit_message:
[WIP] LVM testing for xenial-build-succeeds

These two config files were extracted from the original change
I697bfbf042816c5ddf170bde9534cc4f0c7279ff to do more advanced block
device configuration during the ubuntu-minimal build test.

I (ianw) do not think it is wise to switch the gate defaults to this
without any prior history of runs.  We should incorporate these
advanced jobs ontop of the native zuulv3 jobs in
Ied67a31f0d31503d13eccad8662c29740c93f33e as separate tests.  This is
created so we can easily find the configs.

Change-Id: I65fb573a12eb62dcb1fef4ff81bf14db538f4ce1
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

added_lines: # A complex example which exercises a lot code # of the block-device # The image / partition setup for the root # for the installation. - local_loop: name: image0 - partitioning: base: image0 label: mbr partitions: - name: root flags: [ boot, primary ] size: 100% mkfs: mount: mount_point: / fstab: options: "defaults" fsck-passno: 1 # The initial idea is to have here a LVM which # in turn includes a partition table. # Currently it is not possible to include this, # because a bug is triggered that should be patched # separately. # Uncommon but possible: # An image with a LVM with in turn includes a LVM - local_loop: name: dataimage2 size: 100M - lvm: base: dataimage2 pvs: - name: pvdata2 base: dataimage2 vgs: - name: vgdata2 base: ["pvdata2"] lvs: - name: lvdata2l1 base: vgdata2 size: 70M - name: lvdata2l2 base: vgdata2 size: 5M - lvm: base: lvdata2l1 pvs: - name: pvdata2i base: lvdata2l1 vgs: - name: vgdata2i base: ["pvdata2i"] lvs: - name: lvdata2il1 base: vgdata2i size: 7M - name: lvdata2il2 base: vgdata2i size: 5M - mkfs: name: fsdata2l2 base: lvdata2l2 type: "ext4" mount: mount_point: /lvtest/data2l2 fstab: options: "rw,relatime" fsck-passno: 1

commit_message:
Strip trailing null in env var output

This leads to

 warning: command substitution: ignored null byte in input

with recent bash versions.  Doesn't affect anything, but easy enough
to drop the trailing null and silence the warning.

Change-Id: I620c56a8f47d94dd1242e1c8fb1bd77d76a1e23d

subject: [WIP] Global element defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-22 02:24:46.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'lib/element-common'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/a981088b06bfe12c30dc5e5f64d808995fdb1a6c', 'message': '[WIP] Global element defaults

Currently there is no place to keep global variables to be exported to
all elements.  "lib/common-defaults" seems like it might be it, but
this is not sourced by instack -- it's really "common" to
disk-image-create & ramdisk-image-create

Create a separate file that can be sourced by
[disk|ramdisk]-image-create and instack to provide global variables to
elements.

To facilitate this, we add a "-d" command that outputs the location of
this file.  Wrappers (instack) should ensure this is sourced before
running any element scripts.

Change-Id: Ic37d04420236e45d0c7dc74c4bcfbe5a41d911cd
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Global element defaults

Currently there is no place to keep global variables to be exported to
all elements.  "lib/common-defaults" seems like it might be it, but
this is not sourced by instack -- it's really "common" to
disk-image-create & ramdisk-image-create

Create a separate file that can be sourced by
[disk|ramdisk]-image-create and instack to provide global variables to
elements.

To facilitate this, we add a "-d" command that outputs the location of
this file.  Wrappers (instack) should ensure this is sourced before
running any element scripts.

Change-Id: Ic37d04420236e45d0c7dc74c4bcfbe5a41d911cd

commit_message:
Add DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Currently yum keeps a local package cache and symlinks it into the
build by default, and it can not be turned off.

On the other hand, deb builds have a similar mechanism with
DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE.

Consolidate these into a single DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that is by
default on (maintaining the status-quo) but able to be turned-off.
Add a deprecation note for DIB_APT_LOCAL_CACHE.  Document this in the
developer documentation on caches, and add references to the elements
documentation.

Change-Id: I084d950785f8c557ee795b69e38f13ab1a427322

subject: Add DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE variable
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-03 05:59:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/fba9ed2baed14d7764be93ab4f5cb29e673aa86d', 'message': 'Implement package caching for yum/dnf element

Implement a flag DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE which keeps downloaded
packages.

Note this is incompatible with the current situation of using a yum
cache bind-mounted into the chroot.  We could copy that cache back
into the image at the end, but it might contain all sorts of things
from other runs that are not relevant to the image currently building.
Documentation has been enhanced to discuss this.

The difference in build-size is about:

480M fedora.qcow2
708M fedora-with-cache.qcow2

Change-Id: I55bac1c80bbfd4e94f0446dd15e6673a9573e90a

Implement a flag DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE which keeps downloaded
packages.

Note this is incompatible with the DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that
uses the external package-cache bind-mounted into the chroot.  We
*could* copy that cache back into the image at the end, but it might
contain all sorts of things from other runs that are not relevant to
the image currently building.  Documentation has been enhanced to
discuss this, and the script should fail with a useful message if you
try to enable both.

The DIB_DISABLE_APT_CLEANUP flag is removed for this generic flag.

The difference in build-size for fedora is about:

480M fedora.qcow2
708M fedora-with-cache.qcow2

362M ubuntu.qcow2
450M ubuntu-with-cache.qcow2

Change-Id: I55bac1c80bbfd4e94f0446dd15e6673a9573e90a

commit_message:
Add DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE variable

Implement a flag DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE which keeps downloaded
packages.

Note this is incompatible with the DIB_USE_PACKAGE_CACHE flag that
uses the external package-cache bind-mounted into the chroot.  We
*could* copy that cache back into the image at the end, but it might
contain all sorts of things from other runs that are not relevant to
the image currently building.  Documentation has been enhanced to
discuss this, and the script should fail with a useful message if you
try to enable both.

The DIB_DISABLE_APT_CLEANUP flag is deprecated for this generic flag.

The difference in build-size for fedora is about:

480M fedora.qcow2
708M fedora-with-cache.qcow2

362M ubuntu.qcow2
450M ubuntu-with-cache.qcow2

Change-Id: I55bac1c80bbfd4e94f0446dd15e6673a9573e90a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/21/208321/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # XXX: it might be possible to switch keepcache back to 0 even with # DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE=1. It is not clear if we might inadverently # clear the cache in reponse to some yum/dnf commands; so we take the # conservative route and skip resetting it in that case. if [ "${DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE:-0}" != "1" ]; then sed -i 's/keepcache=1/keepcache=0/' $cfg # note we did not use the external caching scheme when running # with DIB_KEEP_PACKAGE_CACHE so we didn't touch this in that # case. sed -i 's/cachedir=\/tmp\/yum/cachedir=\/var\/cache\/yum/' $cfg # unmount and reset ourselves umount /tmp/yum $YUM clean all fi

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-01-29 03:15:39.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/block_device/level3/mount.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/config/multiple_partitions_tree.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/config/multiple_partitions_graph.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/elements/zypper/finalise.d/10-mkinitrd', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/level2/mkfs.py', 'releasenotes/notes/incorrect-grub-label-5d2000215c0cc73e.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/lib/disk-image-create', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/plugin/test_a.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/test_mount_order.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/tests/plugin/test_b.py', 'diskimage_builder/block_device/blockdevice.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/90f3b02b5cbdf2cdabc2d04bb7d78eca6d904802', 'message': '[DNM] Separate initial state and create state

This is a bunch of work I did to separate out the initial state
from the state created during create()

We have a chicken and egg problem with the get-value calls; some of
them want values that are known after we've parsed all the
configuration (e.g. rootfs mount & file system type) ... logically we
could grab them from the state.  However, since state generation is
wrapped up with the actual create() calls, it's too late.

In theory, we could separate out initial state generation, from the
config file(s), and then do the create as a totally separate call

This has a few unresolved issues.  For example, we call "init" before
finding the size of the disk with "du", then we put the new size value
in and call "create"; which re-reads this.

So quite a lot of refactoring has to be done to get this idea to work.
I'm just putting this here as a record of how to get started if we
need this...

Change-Id: Ic86177015c5c22f32e2d0c598eed28ad891dc218
'}]
commit_message:
[DNM] Separate initial state and create state

This is a bunch of work I did to separate out the initial state
from the state created during create()

We have a chicken and egg problem with the get-value calls; some of
them want values that are known after we've parsed all the
configuration (e.g. rootfs mount & file system type) ... logically we
could grab them from the state.  However, since state generation is
wrapped up with the actual create() calls, it's too late.

In theory, we could separate out initial state generation, from the
config file(s), and then do the create as a totally separate call

This has a few unresolved issues.  For example, we call "init" before
finding the size of the disk with "du", then we put the new size value
in and call "create"; which re-reads this.

So quite a lot of refactoring has to be done to get this idea to work.
I'm just putting this here as a record of how to get started if we
need this...

Change-Id: Ic86177015c5c22f32e2d0c598eed28ad891dc218
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/32/538732/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.add_rollback(self.do_rollback, config['rollback_one_arg']) self.add_rollback(self.do_rollback, config['rollback_two_arg']) def do_rollback(self, string): # We will check this after all rollbacks to make sure they ran # in the right order self.state['rollback_test'].append(string)

commit_message:
Add a parent log to iterate timeout util

With debug logs you get quite a lot of

 2018-06-15 02:06:38,671 DEBUG: openstack.iterate_timeout Waiting 2.0 seconds

as things progress.  Logically these messages are really related to
whatever called them, more than "openstack.iterate_timeout".  For
logging hierarchy purposes you'd prefer for it to be captured with its
parent, as it is indicating a loop happening there.

Add a parent argument to setup_logging that will indicate to register
the new logger as a child of this.

Use this argument in the util.iterate_timeout call

Plumb in some existing loggers as parents for most of the
iterate_timeout calls.

Change-Id: Ibc3afe21e8987b54f1de68bde5c9f1a30201304f

commit_message:
[WIP] handle fedora27 python3 changes

with fedora27, python3 has started installing pip things into
/usr/local.  This means we don't have to work-around overwriting the
system copies.

Change-Id: I046c607c2c0966f102d47f81ff3e053c0a84fece
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/26/532026/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: packages="python2-virtualenv python2-pip python2-setuptools" else packages="python-virtualenv python-pip python-setuptools" # Repeat above for python3. # # Since Fedora 27, distutils is setup to install pip and # dependent packages into the /usr/local/ hierachy, which # keeps things nicely separate. # https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Changes/Making_sudo_pip_safe # However, we want "pip" to be the python2 version, so clear # out /usr/local/bin/pip rm -rf /usr/local/bin/pip # XXX: what does this really achieve? don't we just use # virtualenv -p pythonN # ... is the python3 package any different? mv /usr/local/bin/virtualenv /usr/local/bin/virtualenv-3
deleted_lines: packages="python-virtualenv python-pip python-setuptools" # Repeat above for python3 # You would think that installing python3 bits first, then # python2 would work -- alas get-pip.py doesn't seem to leave # python3 alone: # https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/4435 rm -rf /usr/lib/python3.?/site-packages/setuptools* pip3 install ${pip_args} setuptools # reclaim /usr/bin/pip back to pip2 ln -sf /usr/bin/pip2 /usr/bin/pip

commit_message:
Journal logging format: no hostname

Don't log the hostname.  We already stamp this into the logs (so you
can see what provider you're running on) but it's too much noise on
every line.

Change-Id: I185d12eef5fbbba39b49953797ca11cd0f6d0e5e

commit_message:
Bail on common devuser usernames

Using DIB_DEV_UESR_USERNAME=ubuntu caused a great deal of confusion,
because cloud-init can possibly come along and take over the username,
locking you out of password access and leaving us wondering why the
element didn't work.

Let's just enforce using a different username to avoid anyone else
wasting time with this.

Change-Id: Iae34f9dfbd34e592a3b64fb20e7104110739e623
Closes-Bug: #1766228
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder refs/changes/60/563860/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if [[ ${DIB_DEV_USER_USERNAME} =~ ("ubuntu"|"centos") ]]; then echo "*** DIB_DEV_USER_USERNAME [${DIB_DEV_USER_USERNAME}] conflicts with" echo "*** standard cloud-init created user. Please choose another name" exit 1 fi

commit_message:
Increase backoffLimit to 10 for helm installer

The helm installer often quickly reaches the backoffLimit of 5. Increase
this to 10 so that there is a greater chance of successful installation.

Story: 2006765
Task: 37783

Change-Id: I5293c970bb1696f14c421fdf67abb495b4b8d666
Signed-off-by: Bharat Kunwar <brtknr@bath.edu>

commit_message:
Revert "Fix #1627402: fix grub2 element for ubuntu xenial"

This reverts commit 003fc17208e645b453ccb7c7ad27d332bdae490c.

It seems this special handling is still needed.  The following command
fails with the error of:

 $ disk-image-create -o ubuntu.qcow2 ubuntu grub2
 ...
 "/usr/sbin/grub-probe: error: cannot find a device for / (is /dev mounted?)"

I also confirmed that reverting this change (adding the special
handling back) fixes the image building.

Change-Id: Ieb828a7861249044ce0ed1eb36d089d81992efd0

commit_message:
Use pip list for saved output

With zuulv3 cloning, "pip freeze" doesn't show useful values for repo
installs as they don't have a remote.  Devstack switched to using "pip
list" in I33d25f86b6afcadb4b190a0f6c53311111c64521; do the same here
and also update the help page.

Change-Id: Id30cae9539b796dde51e4ea1834d4247e4b134da

subject: Add ability to download log bundles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 06:03:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-loganalyze/commit/329f5281b26b1cec661681017f3562eccf0e7b24', 'message': "Add ability to download log bundles

TODO : finish test-cases

This change provides a small additional wsgi application to download a
tarball of logs for a single test run.

The idea is for a modified URL such as

  http://logs.openstack.org/download/26/118226/1/gate/gate-grenade-dsvm/fb63ac0/

to initiate a download of a file called
118226_1_gate-grenade-dsvm_fb63ac0.tar.gz which includes a copy of all
logs for the test.

There are many way to skin this cat.  To explain some of the choices

 - the existing log-analyze stuff happens via a wsgi app, so follow
   that lead to avoid any other dependencies

 - The logs are compressed to a temporary file which is streamed back
   via wsgi.  This allows us to set the content-length correctly so
   you get what looks like a normal download, and wsgi streams the
   large file efficiently.

 - log packages are around 7MiB from my testing.  This is big but not
   ridiculous.

 - The risk I can see here is if a unfriendly spider decided to
   request every download it possibly could.  In this case, the script
   would start returning 500 errors when it could not create the
   archive.  Due to the existing way we uncompress files for sending,
   a recursive wget (ignoring robots.txt) would be much harder on the
   server than this would be and that doesn't seem to be a problem at
   the moment (people probably do this now to get access to all the
   logs quickly).  We could partition it to use a separate temp space
   if there is a problem.

 - Probably the best alternative is ZipStream [1].  Several issues:
   the pypi version seems to come from a forked source [2], it's a
   .zip, which isn't super-unixy, we don't know the content-length so
   we get no progress.  Given this and the size of the log packages, I
   don't think it is worth extra complexity.

 - The log link can be provided in the readme stuff that gets
   displayed with the logs when it is active

[1] https://github.com/SpiderOak/ZipStream
[2] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/zipstream

Change-Id: I6741d2514ae9cfef604243b9ce7063817be1ba3a
